Counter-Strike: Source was one of the first games I had on Steam, basically all I had was Half-Life 2, and Half-Life 2 Deathmatch besides it.

I never played the original Counter-Strike before Source, and the only FPS game I played was Medal of Honor: Allied Assault.

Needles to say I got HOOKED.
Especially when you play the game competitively with friends, or in a team/clan.

Nowadays CS:Source seems a mess to me, since the orange box update a lot of things aren't how they were used to be. Luckily CS:GO fills in the gap, I'd recommend that game above CS:Source since it's slowly dying.

Goes without saying that this is one of the greatest games ever relised for any console/pc. 

Theres a reason that this still sells and that it is still used for competitions and played worldwide by hundreds of true gamers everyday.

The simplicity of the game, mixed with the awesome communities you will meet whilst playing on different servers is what puts this so far ahead of the competition even though it was realeased so long ago!

Typically, I think war simulators are stupid. But Counter-Strike: Source is amazing. I don't know why I like it so much, I just do! If you buy this when it's on sale or with Garry's Mod then you'll get your money's worth. Thousands of people still play it so you won't have a hard time finding a server. It's not actaully really a war simulator, either. There's almost no strategy and it doesn't feel like your in the military at all, unlike other games like this such as Ghost Recon. So I do recommend this game very much and if you don't think you'll ever play it but you still play Garry's Mod a lot, just get it for the weapons.
